text: Liberty Fire Company No. 5 is a historic fire station located at Reading, Berks County, Pennsylvania. It was built in 1876, and is a three-story, brick building in the Italianate style. It was originally two-stories, with the third story added in 1895. The third story and roofline is reflective of the Victorian Romanesque style. Note: This includes The building is now operated as the Reading Area Fire-Fighters Museum. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1985. ==References== ==External links== *Official website Reading Area Firefighters Museum *Reading Area Fire-Fighters Museum website Category:Fire stations completed in 1876 Category:Fire stations completed in 1895 Category:Italianate architecture in Pennsylvania Category:Romanesque Revival architecture in Pennsylvania Category:Buildings and structures in Berks County, Pennsylvania Category:Defunct fire stations in Pennsylvania Category:Fire stations on the National Register of Historic Places in Pennsylvania Category:Museums in Reading, Pennsylvania Category:Firefighting museums in the United States Category:National Register of Historic Places in Reading, Pennsylvania Category:1876 establishments in Pennsylvania
title: Liberty Fire Company No. 5
